text:
A3. 

Ensure continuous
tracking + evaluation.

Track your:
-market
-industry
-biz efforts

Utilize the insight
to shift/ innovate as needed. 

The more you track, 
the more patterns begin to emerge. 

Use them to predict
future needs/actions too! 

#WeTalkBiz

#BizHeroes
author: bentleyu

text:
A/B testing = key! 

You have to know
what's working vs. what is not
in order to ensure your $ + time is
being well spent.

A2. 

Research.
Track.
Evaluate.
Adjust. 

Remain vigilant.
Remain flexible.

You have
to constantly
study your:

-efforts
-processes
-resources
-markets
-industry

be willing to pivot
and resort to plan b, c or d.

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
A6

Be authentic! 

Your

-voice
-tone
-personality
-humor
-visuals
-non-verbal language
...

= a part of
your personal brand

Use that to:

Tell stories
Share your insight

in a way that = specific to who you are, what you stand for + what your unique value/view is

#CMWorld.
author: bentleyu

text:
Yes! 
Agreed, Michael! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:

That's an important part of the process! 

You have know how to read the room and adjust accordingly in the moment. 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
All delicious toppings! 
#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
A5. 

How can you
get passed the jitters
before a big presentation?

Practice
Breathe in/out
Visualize success

That best 
way to get over 
the nerves is experience! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
That's the important part, that you are perfecting the skill a little more every time you present! :) 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
Bingo! 
Same here. 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
Love this, Gwen! 
Agreed! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
A4. 

I tend to prefer to winging it! 

I often find that if I rehearse too much, I become fixated on having the presentation be perfect rather than authentic/of value! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
That's a great point, Shelly. 

Every presentation, message, audience, etc. will require a different approach! 

The aim should be for your slides to serve a purpose and help support your goals! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
Yes! 
100%, David! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
Agreed! 
You want to keep the presentation engaging and interactive! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
It sure is! 
#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
Great advice, Joe! 
#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
A3. 

Keep it simple. 

Slides should help 
SUPPORT and/or add 
value to your presentation.

Your voice, actions, visuals
should speak louder than 
the text on your slides. 

#CMworld
author: bentleyu

text:
I love your recommendation to 
offer bite-sized content! 

#CMWorld
author: bentleyu

text:
A2. 

First of all, 
understand your audience. 

Be mindful:

of their interest
of their needs
of your key messaging
of your goals
of your CTA
of your tone
of your voice
of  your visuals
of your time

Be clear.
Be concise.
Be relevant. 
Be engaging. 

#CMWorld.
author: bentleyu

text:
A1. 

Presenting can help 
content marketers:

Develop their storytelling skills
Develop their voice
Develop their tone
Test their CTAs
Create thought leadership
Generate engagement
etc.

text:
A10. 

Be patient. 
Be proactive. 
Be mindful. 
Be intentional.
Be purposeful. 

Make a 
conscious effort
to prioritize/balance efforts. 

Include y
ourself in those
priorities, you are worth it! 

#MTtalk
author: bentleyu

text:

I love connecting with people and learning more about them. 

There's always something that makes that person special and unique. :)

#MTtalk
author: bentleyu

text:
A5

How do you affect those around you
if you live an unbalanced life?

-lack of communication
-lack of clarity 
-lack of direction
-lack of trust
-lack of drive
-lack of collaboration
-lack of empathy

Your actions or inactions
can create tension + corrode relationships

#MTtalk
author: bentleyu

text:
That's a good indicator. 
Breathe, walk away, recharge and regroup! 

(Hey! Btw! :))

#mttalk

in order to establish a sense of stability and fairness.
